pyinterpolate.processing.transform package#

Submodules#

pyinterpolate.processing.transform.statistics module#

Statistical functions.

Authors#

  1. Szymon Moli≈Ñski | @SimonMolinsky

detect_outliers_iqr(dataset: ndarray, iqr_lower=1.5, iqr_upper=1.5)[source]#

Function detects outliers in a dataset based on the inter-quartile ranges and standard deviation.

Parameters:

  • dataset (np.ndarray)

  • iqr_lower (float) ‚Äì How many standard deviations from the 1st quartile down is the limit of expected values.

  • iqr_upper (float) ‚Äì How many standard deviations from the 3rd quartile up is the limit of expected values.

Returns:

mask ‚Äì Boolean mask with positions of outliers.

Return type:

np.ndarray

Raises:

ValueError ‚Äì iqr_upper or iqr_lower are below zero.

detect_outliers_z_score(dataset: ndarray, z_lower=-3, z_upper=3)[source]#

Function detects outliers in a given array.

Parameters:

  • dataset (np.ndarray)

  • z_lower (float) ‚Äì How many standard deviations from the mean is an outlier (left tail).

  • z_upper (float) ‚Äì How many standard deviations from the mean is an outlier (left tail).

Returns:

mask ‚Äì Boolean mask with positions of outliers.

Return type:

np.ndarray

Raises:

ValueError ‚Äì

  • z_dist_lower parameter is greater than 0. * z_dist_upper parameter is lower than 0. * z_dist_upper or z_dist_lower are equal to 0.

remove_outliers(data: Union[Iterable, Dict], method='zscore', z_lower_limit=-3, z_upper_limit=3, iqr_lower_limit=1.5, iqr_upper_limit=1.5) → Union[List, Dict][source]#

Function removes outliers from a given dataset.

Parameters:

  • data (Union[Iterable, Dict]) ‚Äì Dataset containing arrays (or lists) with a raw observations.

  • method (str, default=‚Äôzscore‚Äô) ‚Äì Method used to detect outliers. Can be ‚Äòzscore‚Äô or ‚Äòiqr‚Äô.

  • z_lower_limit (float) ‚Äì Number of standard deviations from the mean to the left side of a distribution. Must be lower than 0.

  • z_upper_limit (float) ‚Äì Number of standard deviations from the mean to the right side of a distribution. Must be greater than 0.

  • iqr_lower_limit (float) ‚Äì Number of standard deviations from the 1st quartile into the lowest values. Must be greater or equal to zero.

  • iqr_upper_limit (float) ‚Äì Number of standard deviations from the 3rd quartile into the largest values. Must be greater or equal to zero.

Returns:

cleaned ‚Äì List or Dict of transformed cleaned values.

Return type:

Union[List, Dict]

Raises:

KeyError ‚Äì Given detection method is not ‚Äòzscore‚Äô or ‚Äòiqr‚Äô.

Data transforming functions.

block_dataframe_to_dict(block_df: Union[DataFrame, GeoDataFrame], idx_col='index', x_col='x', y_col='y', value_col='ds') → Dict[source]#
Parameters:

  • block_df (Union[DataFrame, GeoDataFrame])

  • idx_col (any, default=‚Äôindex‚Äô) ‚Äì Index column name.

  • x_col (any, default=‚Äôx‚Äô) ‚Äì X coordinates.

  • y_col (any, default=‚Äôy‚Äô) ‚Äì Y coordinates.

  • value_col (any, default=‚Äôds‚Äô) ‚Äì Values.

Returns:

{block id: [[numpy array with x, y, value]]}

Return type:

get_areal_centroids_from_agg(aggregated_data: Union[Blocks, GeoDataFrame, DataFrame, ndarray]) → ndarray[source]#
Parameters:

aggregated_data (Union[Blocks, gpd.GeoDataFrame, pd.DataFrame, np.ndarray]) ‚Äì Blocks with aggregated data. * Blocks: Blocks() class object. * GeoDataFrame and DataFrame must have columns: centroid.x, centroid.y, ds, index.

Geometry column with polygons is not used and optional.

  • numpy array: [[block index, centroid x, centroid y, value]].

Returns:

[[cx, cy, val]]

Return type:

numpy array

get_areal_values_from_agg(aggregated_data: Union[Blocks, GeoDataFrame, DataFrame, ndarray], indexes=None) → ndarray[source]#
Parameters:

  • aggregated_data (Union[Blocks, gpd.GeoDataFrame, pd.DataFrame, np.ndarray]) ‚Äì Blocks with aggregated data. * Blocks: Blocks() class object. * GeoDataFrame and DataFrame must have columns: centroid.x, centroid.y, ds, index.

    Geometry column with polygons is not used and optional.

    • numpy array: [[block index, centroid x, centroid y, value]].

  • indexes (Iterable (optional)) ‚Äì List of indexes that are included in the output.

Returns:

[values]

Return type:

numpy array

transform_blocks_to_numpy(blocks: Union[Blocks, GeoDataFrame, DataFrame, ndarray]) → ndarray[source]#

Function transforms blocks data into numpy array.

Parameters:

blocks (Union[Blocks, gpd.GeoDataFrame, pd.DataFrame, np.ndarray]) ‚Äì Blocks with aggregated data. * Blocks: Blocks() class object. * GeoDataFrame and DataFrame must have columns: centroid.x, centroid.y, ds, index.

Geometry column with polygons is not used and optional.

  • numpy array: [[block index, centroid x, centroid y, value]].

Returns:

bvalues ‚Äì Blocks transformed to numpy array [[block index, centroid x, centroid y, value]].

Return type:

numpy array

transform_ps_to_dict(ps: Union[Dict, ndarray, GeoDataFrame, DataFrame, PointSupport]) → Dict[source]#
Parameters:

ps (Union[Dict, np.ndarray, gpd.GeoDataFrame, pd.DataFrame, PointSupport]) ‚Äì

  • Dict: {block id: [[point x, point y, value]]}

  • numpy array: [[block id, x, y, value]]

  • DataFrame and GeoDataFrame: columns={x, y, ds, index}

  • PointSupport

Returns:

Point Support as a Dict: {block id: [[point x, point y, value]]}
